RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 44. Maiden Claiming Purse 16000. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500, if for $7,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JUST A FLIRT took the lead leaving the chute and rated the pace, was hand urged at the rail on the turn, dug in under mild pressure leaving the turn then kept sharp through the lane. ALLEGHENY HERO chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn off the rail and settled for second best. JUBA'S YANKEE ONE chased the leaders, raced in the three path on the turn and took third inside the eighth pole. THE LAST CASTLE gave chase, raced near the rail on the turn, eased out into the lane and finished evenly. KING KJARTAN chased inside, raced near the rail on the turn and showed little in the lane. CHARTERED COURSE gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the five and six paths of the turn, left the turn widest and showed little further. SWEET T gave chase and saved ground on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Just a Flirt
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace,hand urged rail turn,pressured 1/8,kept sharp lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 7F Dirt CR: 93. Starter Allowance Purse 23000. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE APRIL 14, 2021. Weight, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 14 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since February 14 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $8,000 Or L ess Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BEVERLY PARK stalked the earlier pace from the two and three paths, started a three wide bid leaving the three eighths pole and took the nod at the five sixteenths, drew clear toward the quarter pole, widened at the rail on the far turn and was steadily handled in the lane. ANTIPOISON rounded the opening turn in the five path, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn and settled for second. AARON'S TAP raced in the four path the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail then flattened in the lane. RUNABOUT rounded the first turn in the six path and left the turn outside, bid nearing the three eighths pole, raced in the three and four paths of the far turn and could only improve his position. PROTA rated a short lead inside, came under pressure approaching the three eighths pole, was met at the five sixteenths and faded at the rail on the far turn. MUCHACHO MACHO rated close inside, challenged nearing the three eighths pole but faded off the rail on the far turn. NOON TIME GEM raced off the rail on the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Prota
ENTRY.OWNER: A and B Racing Stable LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 3/8,met 5/16,faded rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Aaron's Tap
ENTRY.OWNER: A and B Racing Stable LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Runabout
ENTRY.OWNER: Photos Robert and Englehart Jeffrey S

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 55. Maiden Claiming Purse 13300. FOR MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BABY BULLDOG chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the three path, angled five wide leaving the turn, dueled through the stretch and took over later yards. FLASH OF DAY chased outside, rounded the turn in the six path and was outfinished in the duel through the stretch. MIMS SECOND CHANCE chased the pace toward the inside, rounded the turn near the rail, angled three wide leaving the turn and dueled to a brief slim lead inside the sixteenth pole, but was outfinished in later yards. MY SLICK NICK chased toward the inside, angled to the five path through the turn and finished well. GEM DANCER had a brief early lead then pressured the pace, raced close in the four path on the turn but relented in later yards. FROSTY THE BULL pressured the pace and took the lead two deep past the five sixteenths pole, contested the edge off the rail on the turn then flattened stride later yards. TRICKY STRONG angled out to give chase through the backstretch, raced in the six path of the turn and ran evenly in the lane. VASY SAYS NYET set a pressured pace leaving the half mile pole, was met past the five sixteenths and raced close near the rail on the turn, but weakened inside the sixteenth pole. BAL ROBINSON chased inside and rounded the turn at the rail.

ENTRY.NAME: Baby Bulldog
ENTRY.OWNER: Rose David J and Khalaf Wadie F

ENTRY.NAME: Frosty the Bull
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,lead past 5/16,edge turn,flattened later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Gem Dancer
ENTRY.COMMENT: brief early lead,pressed pace,close 4p turn,relented late yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 14500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 14 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JOHNNY SWISH exchanged contact with Urban Warrior leaving the gate, rounded the first turn in the five path and moved to the front three wide approaching the five sixteenths pole, dueled clear midway on the far turn and was steadily handled in the lane. AMICALOLA FALLS rated the pace inside, came under pressure past the seven sixteenths pole, was met approaching the three eighths and gave chase from that point, then dueled through the stretch for second. SPUNTACULAR settled off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn, eased out into the lane and dueled through the stretch to take third under the wire. TYLER TIME rounded the opening turn in the four path and rated close leaving the turn, bid past the seven sixteenths pole, took a slim lead between horses at the three eighths pole, raced close near the rail into the far turn but dropped back midway through the turn and relented in the duel through the lane. EARTHQUAKEDIRECTOR saved ground well off the pace, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn then flattened in the lane. STAVANGER saved ground well off the pace, gave chase from the five sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and improved his position. FOREVER THE BOSS rated close to the early pace in the two and three paths, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole but dropped back at the five sixteenths and weakened off the rail on the far turn. URBAN WARRIOR exchanged contact with Johnny Swish leaving the gate and rounded the first turn off the rail, was blocked and altered course at the three eighths pole but flattened in the five path of the far turn. MAKE THE WAY CLEAR rounded the first turn about the six path and showed little response through the backstretch. MY MIRACLE MAN saved ground close to the early pace, gave chase leaving the half mile pole but faded through the backstretch. The Stewards reviewed and dismissed a claim of foul against the rider of Johnny Swish for alleged interference on the far turn, lodged by the rider of Amicalola Falls.

ENTRY.NAME: Urban Warrior
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,off rail early,chased 3/8,flattened 5p far turn

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 67. Claiming Purse 13800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races At A Mile Or Over Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibi lity).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MASTER THIS rounded the first turn in the three and four paths, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, eased to the six path on the far turn and took the lead leaving the eighth pole and drew off under steady handling. STRONG HEART raced off the rail on the first turn then eased out into the backstretch, bid approaching the three eighths pole, angled to the five path on the far turn and settled for second best. GANDHI'S ORION stalked from the seven eighths pole, closed to the front toward the three eighths, came under pressure at the five sixteenths pole, was met leaving the far turn and flattened in the lane. PLAYBOY ROY raced off the pace in the three and four paths, started a bid past the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path but showed little in the lane. AMERICAN ROCKY raced well back from early contention in the four and five paths, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole and improved at the rail on the far turn. SIMILAR TASTE settled off the pace inside, gave chase into the backstretch but showed little response. FARTLEK rounded the first turn in the four and five paths, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole but weakened at the rail on the far turn. GORUN was not a factor. DAKOTA BOY took over approaching the seven eighths pole and rated the pace, came under pressure past the half mile pole, was met toward the three eighths and faded approaching the far turn. FRONT PORCH was not a factor.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 76. Allowance Purse 35100. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 14 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since February 14 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BELLA MELA was hustled along with the pace and took the nod two deep leaving the turn, dueled clear toward mid-stretch and held well under steady handling. LORD OF CORK chased inside, raced near the rail on the turn, eased out leaving the turn then dueled through the stretch for second. REATA'S CASTLE gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn near the rail and was outfinished in the stretch duel for second. NOW HOOK'EM exchanged contact with Entry Time leaving the gate, gave chase through the backstretch and raced two deep on the turn, then outfinished in the stretch duel for third. MYSTIC O'SHAUNESIE chased outside, rounded the turn in the five and six paths and closed the gap through the lane. COLT ROCK exchanged contact with Entry Time leaving the gate then engaged in close chase, but dropped back toward the quarter pole, raced in the five path of the turn and ran evenly in the lane. EL LUCERITO was hustled along with the pace inside, contested the edge nearest the rail on the turn, gave up the nod leaving the turn and weakened in the lane. ENTRY TIME was jostled at the break and raced well back, rounded the turn in the four and five paths and improved position in the lane. FOREVER TAKES TIME saved ground. ELEANORS JACK pressured the early pace three wide then weakened leaving the turn.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 67. Claiming Purse 13300. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 14 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PRIMORDIAL FEAR chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn off the rail, dug in for the lead mid-stretch and drew away later yards. D TACHYON chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the four path, drifted leaving the turn but finished well to take second later yards. WAYNE'S HOPE closed to the front approaching the half mile pole and set a pressured pace, raced near the rail on the turn, but was met nearing mid-stretch and weakened the final sixteenth. SUPER KHOZAN broke a step slow, picked up the chase leaving the chute, raced off the rail on the turn, angled out leaving the turn and finished well. BARB'S PRIDE ducked outward and made contact with Taneleer leaving the gate, gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the three path then flattened the final sixteenth. DANCIN IN DUBAI lunged leaving the gate and gave chase, rounded the turn about the seven path and finished evenly to improve his position. TANELEER was bumped sharply leaving the gate, gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the three path on the turn and weakened. ROCKING TO HOME chased inside, rounded the turn at the rail and weakened in the lane. MOTIVATED SPEAKER chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the three path, drifted to the outside leaving the turn and showed little in the lane. JUST GO WITH IT was through early.

ENTRY.NAME: Super Khozan
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow break,chased,off rail turn,angled out 1/8,finished well

ENTRY.NAME: Wayne's Hope
ENTRY.OWNER: Gilbert Melissa Rentz and Oxendine Martin

ENTRY.NAME: Barb's Pride
ENTRY.OWNER: P and H Stables and C and B Stables

ENTRY.NAME: Dancin in Dubai
ENTRY.OWNER: Irish Hill Century Farm and McGuire Matthew

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 78. Allowance Purse 33900. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since February 14 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Consi dered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TIMED OUT stalked from the three path on the first turn, closed to the lead approaching the three eighths pole and ran clear at the five sixteenths, rounded the far turn near the rail and was steadily handled in the stretch. LADY CINCO DE MAYO stalked two deep, picked up the chase leaving the three eighths pole and rounded the far turn about the three path, dug in under steady stretch handling and held second. TIMELY SECRET rounded the first turn about the three path, bid leaving the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn, came along for third mid-stretch and flattened the final sixteenth. MADY ROSE broke a step slow then saved ground, gave chase from the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn, eased out leaving the turn and showed little in the lane. ELLIES LIL CASTLE took over and moved to the inside to rate the pace, was met approaching the three eighths pole, gave chase from that point, rounded the far turn near the rail and weakened in the lane. WILL OR WON'T raced inside on the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. Cousin Winnie became fractious in the gate and was a late scratch.

ENTRY.NAME: Mady Rose
ENTRY.OWNER: O'Sullivan Farms LLC and Dunloe Ventures LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow break,saved ground,chased 3/8,off rail far turn,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Ellies Lil Castle
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,met near 3/8,chased,rail far turn,weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 9 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 72. Claiming Purse 16900. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE OCTOBER 14, 2022 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Weight, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since October 14 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowe d 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TRUE HEIRESS chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn off the rail and dueled to the front past the eighth pole, drew clear mid-stretch and was steadily handled to widen. LITTLE BIT OF THAT pressured the pace inside, contested even terms nearest the rail on the turn, was met past the eighth pole and relented the final sixteenth. CAPTAIN SAM chased, rounded the turn in the four path and dug in through the lane to hold third. MIDNIGHT FLING chased outside, raced in the six path of the turn and finished well to pass rivals. SWEETONTHEGENTS chased through the backstretch, raced in the three path on the turn then flattened inside the sixteenth pole. SALTY SAUL gave chase, rounded the turn about the five path and finished evenly to pass rivals outside. SECRET AFFIRMATION chased through the backstretch, raced in the five path on the turn then flattened inside the eighth pole. UNCANNY was hustled up while tapering in and set a pressured pace, contested even terms from the three path on the turn but drifted into the stretch and gave way. MS HEADLEY chased inside, raced near the rail on the turn and weakened in the lane. SUPER WILDCAT was never a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Sweetonthegents
ENTRY.OWNER: Prostar 10 Stables Inc and The Four Horsemen Racing Stable Inc

ENTRY.NAME: Little Bit of That
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,even terms rail turn,met past 1/8,relented 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Uncanny
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled up,set pressured pace,even terms 3p turn,drifted,gave way
